meanings.definition: To move or progress slowly and laboriously.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar wormed its way through the leaves.
meanings.sent2: The snake wormed through the narrow tunnel.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wormed out of the tight spot under the fence.
meanings.sent4: The roots wormed their way into the cracks of the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The inchworm wormed along the branch, inch by inch.

meanings.definition: To extract information by persistent questioning or tortuous means.
meanings.sent1: The detective wormed the truth out of the suspect.
meanings.sent2: She wormed the secret out of her friend after much persuasion.
meanings.sent3: The journalist wormed the scoop out of the reluctant source.
meanings.sent4: He wormed the password out of the computer system.
meanings.sent5: The spy wormed valuable information out of the enemy agent.
